Name: Kohl jar
Description: Small vessel of Egyptian alabaster designed to contain the classic black lead eye pigment of the ancient Egyptians (Arabic kohl), traces of which appear in the interior. The flat lid of this example is missing, but otherwise it is a fine example of the kohl containers in use during the Middle Kingdom. This example comes from the rich cemetery near modern Hu, ancient Hut-sekhem, regional capital for the seventh province of Upper Egypt.
